subject: Re: [junit] Using the Reflection API for private methods?  Package access?
msgSnippet: ...  As usual, Vladimir provides the opposite opinion and makes it almost seem plausible. :) J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
>So said Vladimir R. Bossicard on 4/13/2003 --------------------
>> 1. We separate the test cases in an own package. Is that best
>> practice?
>
>It's really up to you to decide. I always have my tests in the same
>package and
>happily survived this situation until now.
>
>In fact I don't understand why someone would want to set hurdles by having
>a new
>package for the tests. Testing should not be a challenge (although it
>sometimes
>is) so keep your options open and place your tests in the same package.
>If you
>never need to test your protected methods, fine. But if you suddendly
>have to,
>you still have the option to easily do so.
<snip />

As usual, Vladimir provides the opposite opinion and makes it almost seem plausible. :)
